pageContext.claim: “He never made the statement. He came out with the statement that -- honestly, you know, I've heard over the years that General Mattis is an intellect. And when I read his statement, I asked him whether or not this was true. He said, ‘Not only is it not true; I'd like to write a statement.’ I said, ‘Thank you very much. That's very nice.’”
pageContext.analysis: Trump says Defense Secretary Jim Mattis offered to release a statement pushing back on Bob Woodward's book, "Fear." But on the same day hours earlier, the president said the opposite: "Without my even knowing about it, statements were put out by General Kelly, by General Mattis."
